headlines.linkText: Dominant Verlander pitches Tigers to ALCS

images.caption: Joaquin Benoit is congratulated by Justin Verlander after the Tigers beat the Athletics on Thursday to win Game 5 of the American League Division Series.
images.name: Detroit Tigers 131010 [300x200]

images.caption: BBTN Spotlight: Justin Verlander was dominant in eight innings of work and Miguel Cabrera hit a two-run home run to help the Tigers win 3-0 and eliminate the Athletics.
images.name: Verlander's Gem Puts Tigers In ALCS

video.title: Verlander's Gem Puts Tigers In ALCS

tracking.trackingName: COM_MLB Highlight (BBTN Spotlight: Tigers/Athletics) 2013/10/10 ESHEET Baseball Tonight

video.description: BBTN Spotlight: Justin Verlander was dominant in eight innings of work and Miguel Cabrera hit a two-run home run to help the Tigers win 3-0 and eliminate the Athletics.

video.title: Verlander: Every Pitch Was Magnified

tracking.trackingName: COM_MLB Interview (Justin Verlander after Game 5) 2013/10/10 SportsCenter

video.description: Justin Verlander discusses his Game 5 gem that helped lift the Tigers into the ALCS.

video.title: Cabrera Focused On Next Round
video.description: Miguel Cabrera discusses his two-run home run and Justin Verlander's performance in the Tigers' Game 5 win.

related.title: 2013 AL Division Series -- Sonny Gray to start for Oakland Athletics

headlines.headline: Justin Verlander's gem in Game 5 sends Tigers to ALCS
headlines.description: Justin Verlander pitched another Game 5 gem in Oakland while carrying a no-hit bid into the seventh inning, and Miguel Cabrera homered to lead the Detroit Tigers past the Athletics 3-0 on Thursday night and back into the AL Championship Series.

headlines.title: Manny Machado of Baltimore Orioles opts for knee surgery
headlines.linkText: Orioles' Machado opts for surgery on knee

images.caption: Manny Machado has opted for knee surgery after suffering a gruesome injury against the Rays last month that led to his being carted off the field.
images.name: Machado_Manny 130923 [288x162]

images.caption: Dan Szymborski with the latest on Manny Machado's decision to have surgery on his knee.

headlines.shortLinkText: Orioles' Machado opts for surgery on knee

related.title: Manny Machado of Baltimore Orioles relieved after 'terrifying' moment
Manny Machado of Baltimore Orioles tears ligament; ACL, MCL are OK

headlines.headline: Manny Machado faces lengthy rehab
headlines.description: Baltimore Orioles third baseman Manny Machado has opted to have reconstructive surgery on his left knee and faces four to six months of rehab, MLB.com reported Thursday night.

headlines.headline: NLCS Game 1: Kelly vs. Greinke
headlines.description: Carpets were still drying out from a champagne bath and a few players looked bleary eyed after a workout at Busch Stadium. A day after advancing, there wasn't much time to rest for the St. Louis Cardinals.

headlines.title: Texas Rangers re-sign reliever Jason Frasor to 1-year deal
headlines.linkText: Rangers re-sign reliever Frasor to 1-year deal
headlines.headline: Jason Frasor re-signs with Rangers
headlines.description: The Texas Rangers are keeping at least one of their veteran bullpen pieces, inking right-handed pitcher Jason Frasor to a one-year deal worth $1.75 million plus incentives.

headlines.headline: Andre Ethier a possibility for Game 1
headlines.description: Los Angeles Dodgers outfielder Andre Ethier could play center field in Game 1 of the National League Championship Series on Friday, manager Don Mattingly said Thursday.

headlines.title: Troy Tulowitzki, Carlos Gonzalez won't be traded, Colorado Rockies owner says
headlines.linkText: Rockies owner: Tulo, Gonzo won't be dealt

images.caption: Carlos Gonzalez made his last plate appearance on Aug. 4 due to a badly sprained right middle finger.
images.name: Gonzalez_Carlos 131008 [200x300]

headlines.shortLinkText: Rockies owner: Tulo, Gonzo won't be dealt

related.title: Carlos Gonzalez of Colorado Rockies elects not to have finger surgery
Colorado Rockies' Michael Cuddyer wins first batting title

headlines.headline: Rockies owner: Plan is to keep them
headlines.description: Colorado Rockies owner Dick Monfort has made it clear that he doesn’t intend to trade all-star players Carlos Gonzalez and Troy Tulowitzki during the offseason.

headlines.linkText: Wainwright, Cards KO Pirates, reach NLCS

images.caption: The Cardinals celebrated on their home field Wednesday night, the same place they'll be Friday in Game 1 of the NLCS against the Dodgers.
images.name: St. Louis Cardinals 131009 [300x200]

images.caption: SC Highlight of the Night: Adam Wainwright's complete game helped the Cardinals advance to the NLCS with a 6-1 win against the Pirates.
images.name: Wainwright Lifts Cards Past Pirates

video.title: Wainwright Lifts Cards Past Pirates

tracking.trackingName: COM_MLB Highlight (SC Highlight of the Night: Cardinals/Pirates) 2013/10/09 ESHEET SportsCenter

video.description: SC Highlight of the Night: Adam Wainwright's complete game helped the Cardinals advance to the NLCS with a 6-1 win against the Pirates.

related.title: NLCS -- Zack Greinke to start Game 1 for Los Angeles Dodgers

headlines.headline: Adam Wainwright's complete game lifts Cards by Pirates in Game 5
headlines.description: Adam Wainwright pitched a complete game and the St. Louis Cardinals got two-run homers from David Freese and Matt Adams to beat the Pittsburgh Pirates 6-1 on Wednesday night and advance to the NL Championship Series.

headlines.title: Joe Girardi returns as New York Yankees manager
headlines.linkText: Girardi returns to Yankees on 4-year deal

images.caption: Joe Girardi has managed the Yankees to three AL East titles and a World Series championship in 2009.
images.name: Girardi_Joe1 131009 [300x200]

images.caption: Andrew Marchand discusses Joe Girardi's decision to return as Yankees manager.
images.name: Joe Girardi Staying In The Bronx

video.title: Joe Girardi Staying In The Bronx

video.description: Andrew Marchand discusses Joe Girardi's decision to return as Yankees manager.

audio.title: Joe Girardi, Yankees
audio.description: Yankees manager Joe Girardi talks about his decision to remain in New York, Mariano Rivera's retirement, Robinson Cano's free agency, the statuses of Alex Rodriguez and Derek Jeter and more.

headlines.headline: Joe Girardi re-signs with Yankees
headlines.description: Joe Girardi has signed a four-year contract to return as the New York Yankees' manager, the team announced Wednesday.

headlines.shortLinkText: Red Sox plan to start Lester in ALCS opener
headlines.headline: Jon Lester likely to start Game 1
headlines.description: Boston Red Sox manager John Farrell stopped short of finalizing his rotation for the American League Championship Series, saying only that he’ll “probably lead off with [Jon] Lester.”
